thread.title: Panthers lead LEC with 67 Fall 2024 All-Academic Team honorees
thread.title_full: Panthers lead LEC with 67 Fall 2024 All-Academic Team honorees

author: @psupanthers
title: Panthers lead LEC with 67 Fall 2024 All-Academic Team honorees
text: General 12/5/2024 10:00:00 AM Panthers lead LEC with 67 Fall 2024 All-Academic Team honorees PLYMOUTH, N.H. – The Little East Conference (LEC) announced 67 Plymouth State University student-athletes competing in the league's fall championship sports have been named to the 2024 LEC Fall All-Academic Team on Thursday. To earn LEC All-Academic Team honors a student-athlete must be at least a sophomore in the classroom, have a cumulative GPA of 3.30 or higher through the completion of the previous semester and have been at their current institution for at least one full academic year. A total of 444 student-athletes league-wide were recognized in the sports of men's and women's cross country, field hockey, men's golf, men's and women's soccer, women's tennis and women's volleyball. Plymouth State's 67 honorees were the most in the conference, with Eastern Connecticut (65) and VTSU Castleton (58) rounding out the top three. The conference's winter and spring sport All-Academic Teams will be announced following the conclusion of their respective championship seasons. By the Numbers (PSU totals in parenthesis): 30 student-athletes maintain a 4.00 cumulative GPA (3) 116 student-athletes have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.90 (18) 203 student-athletes have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.75 (33) 359 student-athletes have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.50 (57) Totals by Sport: Men's Cross Country (9 Institutions) – 35 (9) Women's Cross Country (9 Institutions) – 44 (8) Field Hockey (7 Institutions) – 66 (9) Men's Golf (6 Institutions) – 28 (0 – PSU does not sponsor sport) Men's Soccer (9 Institutions) – 74 (14) Women's Soccer (9 Institutions) – 113 (12) Women's Tennis (9 Institutions) – 35 (4) Women's Volleyball (9 Institutions) – 49 (11) Totals by Institution: Plymouth State – 67 Eastern Connecticut – 65 VTSU Castleton – 58 Keene State – 54 Southern Maine – 51 UMass Boston – 45 UMass Dartmouth – 45 Western Connecticut – 37 Rhode Island College – 15 Affiliate members – 7 Individual Honorees by Sport: Men's Cross Country (9) Name Class Major Hometown Nathan Beauregard So.
